definition: same as 稀爛|稀烂[xi1 lan4]
rare/uncommon/watery/sparse
Ba state during Zhou dynasty (in east of modern Sichuan)/abbr. for east Sichuan or Chongqing/surname Ba/abbr. for Palestine or Palestinian/abbr. for Pakistan

to long for/to wish/to cling to/to stick to/sth that sticks/close to/next to/spread open/informal abbr. for bus 巴士[ba1 shi4]/bar (unit of pressure)/nominalizing suffix on certain nouns, such as 尾巴[wei3 ba5], tail
soft/mushy/well-cooked and soft/to rot/to decompose/rotten/worn out/chaotic/messy/utterly/thoroughly/crappy/bad

sentences.english: She cut the coat she bought for him into pieces.
sentences.chinese: 她把她买给他的那件外套剪了个稀巴烂。

sentences.english: He smashed the radio to pieces.
sentences.chinese: 他啪的一声把收音机摔得稀巴烂。

sentences.english: Joe smashed the large bug under his shoe.
sentences.chinese: 乔用鞋子把那只大虫子踩个稀巴烂。

sentences.english: He would pun you into shivers with his fist.
sentences.chinese: 他会用拳头把你打得稀巴烂。

sentences.english: I could squash you like a bug right now.
sentences.chinese: 我现在能像拍虫子一样把你拍个稀巴烂。

sentences.english: Recently he is beat by class leader and study commissary .
sentences.chinese: 前些天被班长和学习委员冲进他家揍个稀巴烂。

definition: smashed up/broken into pieces/thoroughly mashed/pulpy
to smash
(idiom) everything broken and in disorder
bits and pieces/scattered fragments
all split up and in pieces (idiom); disunity (in an organization)/complete lack of unity/to disintegrate/falling apart/to be at sixes and sevens
to crush/to smash/to shatter
to pulverize/to smash to bits
to be badly mangled or mutilated (idiom)
to be looking for one's teeth all over the floor/(fig.) to get beaten up badly/to beat the crap out of (sb)
upside down/upturned
see 百孔千瘡|百孔千疮[bai3 kong3 qian1 chuang1]
confused/distracted
to destroy in an explosion/to break (by bombing)
shapeless/deformed/ruined/beyond recognition/(of a person) reduced to a shadow
a bloody nose and a swollen face/badly battered
half dead (of torment, hunger, tiredness etc)/(tired) to death/(terrified) out of one's wits/(beaten) to within an inch of one's life/(knock) the daylights out of sb
